intro: Psychotria thwaitesii var. zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Sri Lanka, and thrives in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
